Applying Direct Bill Payments

Lesson
objectives ¢ Explain how a payment allocation plan filters

and prioritizes payment allocation

* Describe how payments are automatically
allocated

* Override the default allocation when making a
single payment

Payment allocation

i Applying a payment

Marcus:

Business When BillingCenter
Analyst .
receives a payment, how
does it apply the money?

You know about invoices
and payments. Now let’s
put them together. The
payment allocation plan
provides the answer.

Zhang
Billing Clerk

Payment allocation plan specifies how to apply funds

BillingCenter

i Steps for allocating a payment (1 of 3) G

1. BillingCenter identifies the set of unsettled (not fully paid) invoice items to target
for payment.

2. Partition &
Rank

Identify a set of unsettled invoice
items to target for payments

i Steps for allocating a payment (2 of 3) G

2. The eligible invoice items from the Filter step are grouped according to the
priorities specified in the payment allocation plan

« For example, pay invoice items in order of their placement dates

2. Partition &
Rank

Identify a set of unsettled invoice

items to target for payments Partition items from step

1 by priority

i Steps for allocating a payment (3 of 3) G

3. BillingCenter allocates the money to the eligible invoice items in each group until
no more money is available.

* Invoice items within the same partition have equal rank

2. Partition &
Rank

Identify a set of unsettled invoice
items to target for payments Partition items from step
1 by priority Pay items pro rata in each partition
until money is exhausted or all
eligible items are settled

i Payment allocation plan Gi

* The payment allocation plan manages: Samet account

« Automatic allocation of payments associated
with a policy or invoice Payment Allocation

Payment Allocation Plan Default Payment Allocation Plan

« Automatic allocation of money in unapplied funds

* Default allocation of a payment in the
Direct Bill Payment screen

* The payment allocation plan specifies: < payment
g 7.
* The invoice items that are eligible to be paid allocation

plan

* The order to pay items if all eligible items cannot be fully paid
¢ Every account has a single payment allocation plan

* Same plan manages allocation for all policies paid by the account

i Payment allocation plans Gi

Administration tab > Business Settings > Payment Allocation Plans
Default Payment Allocation Plan [aie |

Payment Allocation Plan
Name Default Payment Allocation Plan

The default allocation plan for payment, excess unapplied, account negative

Description 7
items, and other forms of available "cash".

Effective Date 01/01/1990

Expiration Date

What invoice items should be paid? (=
Name >
Policy Period -ms to those on the incoming payment's associated policy period. 41. Filters determine
Positive sms to those with amounts greater than zero. eligible invoice
Billed or Due sms to those that are billed or due. ite
Invoice items to those on the incoming payment's associated invoice. ems
What order do you want to pay them in? LM
Priority Name > Description > Move Priority ==§== 2. Eligible invoice
1 Recapture Ci Pay invoice items with recapture charges first. =, Are
lecapture Charges Pay invoice items with recapture charges first == items are paid in

2 Placement Date Pay invoice items in order of their placement dates.

priority order

3 ChargePattern Pay invoice items according to charge pattern priority.

Every has a single payment allocation plan.

3. Given these payment allocation steps:

step 2 is relevant only if
The Spread Excess Even priority applies to invoice items only.

Abatch process will never allocate money in an unapplied fund to invoice
items that are

soe eeceseesesesesees

Soe ee ee eee Soo eSeoe Ss

_- — Complete each sentence by filling in the blanks with
the correct word or phrase.

An invoice item that has not been fully paid is (e) unsettled.
Every (g) account has a single payment allocation plan.

Given these payment allocation steps:

step 2 is relevant only if (f) there is not enough money to fully pay eligible items.

The Spread Excess Even priority applies to (c) planned invoice items only.

Abatch process will never allocate money in an unapplied fund to invoice
items that are (d) from a policy with a different unapplied fund.

The Policy Period and Invoice filters apply when a batch process is
allocating a (b) payment but not when it is allocating (a) money from an unapplied fund.

i Overriding the payment allocation plan Gi

Marcus

Business
Analyst Is there anyway to override
° the behavior of the

payment allocation plan?

Zhang \j
Billing Clerk

There is! Let’s revisit the
Direct Bill Payment screen.

i Payment allocation plan controls default allocation [5

Account tab> Actions > New Payment > New Direct Bill Payment

* Specify which items to include in the allocation
¢ Specify the amount to allocate to each target (invoice item, invoice, policy period)
« Add invoice items from other policies

Question

_— — Assuming an account with policy-level billing and cash separation, can
Y you add an invoice item from Policy A to a direct bill payment allocation
for Policy B?

SSeS ee ee eee Soo Se Seoe

Gi

Answer Gi

_— — Assuming an account with policy-level billing and cash separation, can
7 you add an invoice item from Policy A to a direct bill payment allocation
for Policy B?

Yes. Using the Direct Bill Payment screen:
1.Click Override Distribution.
2.Click Add Items.

Soe ee ee eee Soo eSeoe Ss
